name: AWS Lambda functions with tracing not enabled
description:
TracingConfig is a property of the AWS::Lambda::Function resource that configures tracing settings for your AWS Lambda (Lambda) function. When enabled, AWS Lambda tracing acitivates AWS X-Ray service that collects information on requests that a specific function performed. It reduces the time and effort for debugging and diagnosing the errors.

The value can be either PassThrough or Active. If PassThrough, Lambda will only trace the request from an upstream service if it contains a tracing header with 'sampled=1'. If Active, Lambda will respect any tracing header it receives from an upstream service. If no tracing header is received, Lambda will call X-Ray for a tracing decision.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'aws' AND api.name = 'aws-lambda-list-functions' AND json.rule = 'tracingConfig.mode equals PassThrough'
recommendation:
1. Login to AWS Console
2. Go to AWS Lambda console
3. Click on the specific Function from Functions (Left Pane)
4. Under 'Debugging and error handling' pane, select the check box named as 'Enable active tracing'
5. Click Save
